problem: Let $\theta$ be an angle such that $\sin 2 \theta = \frac{1}{3}.$  Compute $\sin^6 \theta + \cos^6 \theta.$
solution:
We can factor $\cos^6 \theta + \sin^6 \theta$ to get
\begin{align*}
\cos^6 \theta + \sin^6 \theta &= (\cos^2 \theta + \sin^2 \theta)(\cos^4 \theta - \cos^2 \theta \sin^2 \theta + \sin^4 \theta) \\
&= \cos^4 \theta - \cos^2 \theta \sin^2 \theta + \sin^4 \theta.
\end{align*}Squaring the equation $\cos^2 \theta + \sin^2 \theta = 1,$ we get
\[\cos^4 \theta + 2 \cos^2 \theta \sin^2 \theta + \sin^4 \theta = 1.\]Hence,
\[\cos^4 \theta - \cos^2 \theta \sin^2 \theta + \sin^4 \theta = 1 - 3 \cos^2 \theta \sin^2 \theta.\]From $\sin 2 \theta = \frac{1}{3},$
\[2 \sin \theta \cos \theta = \frac{1}{3},\]so $\cos \theta \sin \theta = \frac{1}{6}.$  Therefore,
\[1 - 3 \cos^2 \theta \sin^2 \theta = 1 - 3 \left( \frac{1}{6} \right)^2 = \boxed{\frac{11}{12}}.\]
model_solution:
Using the double-angle identity for sine, we can write
\begin{align*}
\sin 2\theta &= 2\sin\theta\cos\theta = \frac{1}{3}.
\end{align*}
First, note that we have an expression for $\sin 2\theta$, which is equal to $2\sin\theta\cos\theta$. To express $\sin^6\theta + \cos^6\theta$ in terms of $\sin 2\theta$, notice that $(\sin\theta+\cos\theta)^2 = \sin^2\theta + 2\sin\theta\cos\theta + \cos^2\theta.$
From this, we get $\sin^2\theta+\cos^2\theta = (\sin\theta+\cos\theta)^2 - 2\sin\theta\cos\theta.$ Since $\sin^2\theta+\cos^2\theta=1$, we get that $(\sin\theta+\cos\theta)^2-2\sin\theta\cos\theta = 1.$
Now if we let $x = \sin\theta + \cos\theta,$ we get that $x^2-2\sin\theta\cos\theta = 1,$ or $x^2-1 = 2\sin\theta\cos\theta.$ Since $\sin 2\theta = 2\sin\theta\cos\theta,$ this becomes $x^2 - 1 = \sin 2\theta.$
Now we have 
\begin{align*}
\sin^6 \theta + \cos^6 \theta &= (\sin\theta)^6 + 2(\sin\theta)^4(\cos\theta)^2 + 2(\sin\theta)^2(\cos\theta)^4 + (\cos\theta)^6\\
&= (\sin\theta)^6 + 2(\sin\theta)^4\cos^2\theta + 2\sin^2\theta(\cos\theta)^4 + (\cos\theta)^6\\
&= (\sin\theta)^6 + 2(\sin\theta)^4(1 - \sin^2\theta) + 2\sin^2\theta(1 - \sin^2\theta)^2 + (1 - \sin^2\theta)^3\\
&= (\sin\theta)^6 + 2(\sin\theta)^4 - 2(\sin\theta)^6\sin^2\theta + 2\sin^2\theta - 2\sin^4\theta + 2\sin^6\theta - 6\sin^4\theta\cos^2\theta + 6\sin^2\theta\cos^4\theta + 1 - 3\sin^2\theta + 3\sin^4\theta\\
&= (\sin\theta)^6 + 2(\sin\theta)^4 - 2(\sin\theta)^6\sin^2\theta + 2\sin^2\theta - 2\sin^4\theta + 2\sin^6\theta - 6\sin^4\theta + 6\sin^2\theta - 6\sin^4\theta + 3\sin^4\theta + 1 - 3\sin^2\theta\\
&= (\sin\theta)^6 - 2(\sin\theta)^6\sin^2\theta + 2\sin^6\theta + 2\sin^2\theta - 2\sin^4\theta - 3\sin^4\theta + 6\sin^2\theta\\
&= (\sin\theta)^6(1 - 2\sin^2\theta + 2) + 2\sin^2\theta - 5\sin^4\theta + 6\sin^2\theta\\
&= (\sin\theta)^6(1 - 2\sin^2\theta + 2) + 8\sin^2\theta - 5\sin^4\theta\\
&= (\sin\theta)^6(3 - 2\sin^2\theta) + 8\sin^2\theta - 5\sin^4\theta\\
&= 3(\sin\theta)^6 - 2(\sin\theta)^8 + 8\sin^2\theta - 5\sin^4\theta.
\end{align*}
We can now note that $2\sin^2\theta - 1 = -\cos 2\theta$ and $4\sin^2\theta(1 - \sin^2\theta) = 4\sin^2\theta\cos^2\theta.$
We can then factor $\sin^6\theta + \cos^6\theta = (\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta)^3 - 3\sin^2\theta\cos^2\theta(2 - \sin^2\theta - \cos^2\theta)$ as follows:
\begin{align*}
(\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta)^3 - 3\sin^2\theta\cos^2\theta(2 - \sin^2\theta - \cos^2\theta)&= (1)^3- 3\sin^2\theta\cos^2\theta(2 - \sin^2\theta - \cos^2\theta)\\
&= 1 - 3\sin^2\theta\cos^2\theta(2 - \sin^2\theta - \cos^2\theta)\\
&= 1 - 3\sin^2\theta\cos^2\theta(2 - 1)\\
&= 1 - 3\sin^2\theta\cos^2\theta\\
&= 1 - 3(\sin\theta\cos\theta)^2\\
&= 1 - 3(\sin 2\theta/2)^2\\
&= 1 - 3(\sin 2\theta)^2/4\\
&= 1 - 3\sin^2 2\theta/4\\
&= 4/4 - 3\sin^2 2\theta/4\\
&= 1 - 3\sin^2 2\theta/4\\
&= (4 - 3\sin^2 2\theta)/4\\
&= (4 - 3(1/3)^2)/4\\
&= (4 - 3/9)/4\\
&= (36 - 3)/36\\
&= 33/36\\
&= 11/12\\
\end{align*}
as requested.
